resources.string: Parameters:
Returns:
Examples:
Creates an absolute reference to result of line.
Returns the trigonometric sine of an angle.
an angle, in radians.
an angle, in degrees.
an angle, in gradians.
the sine of x
Returns the arc sine of a value; the returned angle is in the range -pi/2 through pi/2.
the value whose arc sine is to be returned.
the arc sine of the x.
Returns the hyperbolic sine of a value. The hyperbolic sine of x is defined to be (ex - e-x)/2 where e is Euler\'s number.
the number whose hyperbolic sine is to be returned.
the hyperbolic sine of x.
Returns the trigonometric cosine of an angle.
an angle, in radians.
an angle, in degrees.
an angle, in gradians.
the cosine of the x.
Returns the arc cosine of a value; the returned angle is in the range 0.0 through pi.
the value whose arc cosine is to be returned.
the arc cosine of the argument.
Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a value. The hyperbolic cosine of x is defined to be (ex + e-x)/2 where e is Euler\'s number.
the number whose hyperbolic cosine is to be returned.
the hyperbolic cosine of x.
Returns the trigonometric tangent of an angle.
an angle, in radians.
an angle, in degrees.
an angle, in gradians.
the tangent of x.
Returns the arc tangent of a value; the returned angle is in the range -pi/2 through pi/2.
the value whose arc tangent is to be returned.
the arc tangent of the x.

Returns the hyperbolic tangent of a value. The hyperbolic tangent of x is defined to be (ex - e-x)/(ex + e-x), in other words, sinh(x)/cosh(x). Note that the absolute value of the exact tanh is always less than 1.
The number whose hyperbolic tangent is to be returned.
the hyperbolic tangent of x.
Returns the base 10 logarithm of a value.
a value
the base 10 logarithm of x
Returns the base 2 logarithm of a value.
a value
the base 2 logarithm of x
Returns the natural logarithm (base e) of a value.
a value
the value ln x, the natural logarithm of x.
Returns Euler\'s number e raised to the power of a value.
the exponent to raise e to.
the value ea, where e is the base of the natural logarithms.
Returns the closest int to the x, with ties rounding up.
a floating-point value to be rounded to an integer.
the value of the x rounded to the nearest int value.
Returns the smallest (closest to negative infinity) value that is greater than or equal to the argument and is equal to a mathematical integer.
a value.
the smallest (closest to negative infinity) floating-point value that is greater than or equal to the argument and is equal to a mathematical integer.
Returns the largest (closest to positive infinity) value that is less than or equal to the argument and is equal to a mathematical integer.
a value
the largest (closest to positive infinity) floating-point value that less than or equal to the argument and is equal to a mathematical integer.
Rounds a number to a certain number of decimal places according to standard rules.
the value to round to places number of places.
the number of decimal places to which to round.places may be negative, in which case value is rounded at the specified number of digits to the left of the decimal point.
the value of the x rounded
Rounds a number to a certain number of decimal places, always rounding up to the next valid increment.
the value to round to places number of places, always rounding up.
the number of decimal places to which to round.places may be negative, in which case value is rounded at the specified number of digits to the left of the decimal point.
the value of the x rounded
Rounds a number to a certain number of decimal places, always rounding down to the next valid increment.
the value to round to places number of places, always rounding down.
the number of decimal places to which to round.places may be negative, in which case value is rounded at the specified number of digits to the left of the decimal point.
the value of the x rounded
Returns the cube root value. For positive finite x, cbrt(-x) == -cbrt(x); that is, the cube root of a negative value is the negative of the cube root of that value\'s magnitude.
a value
the cube root of x.
Returns the absolute value. If the argument is not negative, the argument is returned. If the argument is negative, the negation of the argument is returned.
the argument whose absolute value is to be determined.
Returns the absolute value.If the argument is not negative, the argument is returned.If the argument is negative, the negation of the argument is returned.
Convert the value from %1$s into %2$s.
the value of conversion-source
the value of conversion-destination
Convert a currency from %1$s into %2$s. The exchange rate is updated once a day.
the value of conversion-source
the value of conversion-destination
Returns the sum of a series of numbers and/or line references.
The first line reference.
The second line reference.
Returns the sum of values.
Returns the average of a series of numbers and/or line references.
The first line reference.
The second line reference.
Returns the average of values.
Returns the maximum of a series of numbers and/or line references.
The first line reference.
The second line reference.
Returns the maximum value.
Returns the minimum of a series of numbers and/or line references.
The first line reference.
The second line reference.
Returns the minimum value.
Returns the variance of a series of numbers and/or line references.
The first line reference.
The second line reference.
Returns the variance of values.
Returns the standard deviation of a series of numbers and/or line references.
The first line reference.
The second line reference.
Returns the standard deviation of values.
Returns the median of a series of numbers and/or line references.
The first line reference.
The second line reference.
Returns the median of values.
Calculates the payment for a loan based on constant payments and a constant interest rate.
The interest rate for the loan.
The total number of payments for the loan.
The present value, or the total amount that a series of future payments is worth now.
The future value, or a cash balance you want to attain after the last payment is made.
Indicates when payments are due. 0:At the end of the period 1:At the beginning of the period
Returns the periodic payment amount.
Returns the interest payment for a given period for an investment based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate.
The interest rate per period.
The period for which you want to find the interest and must be in the range 1 to nper.
The total number of payment periods in an annuity.
The present value, or the lump-sum amount that a series of future payments is worth right now.
The future value, or a cash balance you want to attain after the last payment is made.
Indicates when payments are due. 0:At the end of the period 1:At the beginning of the period
Returns the interest portion of payment.
Calculates the payment on the principal for a given period for an investment based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate.
The interest rate per period.
Specifies the period and must be in the range 1 to nper.
The total number of payment periods in an annuity.
The total amount that a series of future payments is worth now.
The future value, or a cash balance you want to attain after the last payment is made.
Indicates when payments are due. 0:At the end of the period 1:At the beginning of the period
Returns the principal portion of payment.
Calculates the future value of an investment based on a constant interest rate.
The interest rate per period.
The total number of payment periods in an annuity.
The payment made each period.
The present value, or the lump-sum amount that a series of future payments is worth right now.
Indicates when payments are due. 0:At the end of the period 1:At the beginning of the period
Returns the future principal value.
Calculates the present value of a loan or an investment, based on a constant interest rate.
The interest rate per period.
The total number of payment periods in an annuity.
The payment made each period and cannot change over the life of the annuity.
The future value, or a cash balance you want to attain after the last payment is made.
Indicates when payments are due. 0:At the end of the period 1:At the beginning of the period
Returns the present value of a loan.
Returns the number of periods for an investment based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate.
The interest rate per period.
The payment made each period. it cannot change over the life of the annuity.
The present value, or the lump-sum amount that a series of future payments is worth right now.
The future value, or a cash balance you want to attain after the last payment is made.
Indicates when payments are due. 0:At the end of the period 1:At the beginning of the period
Returns the number of periods for an investment based on periodic.
Returns the interest rate per period of an annuity. RATE is calculated by iteration and can have zero or more solutions.
The total number of payment periods in an annuity.
The payment made each period and cannot change over the life of the annuity.
The present value.
The future value, or a cash balance you want to attain after the last payment is made.
Indicates when payments are due. 0:At the end of the period 1:At the beginning of the period
Your guess for what the rate will be.
Returns the interest rate per period of an annuity.
